We have to treat history, and figures within it, as complex. Over-simplification into goodies and baddies is rarely useful and sometimes downright dangerous, as it lulls us into thinking things like:

"Oh it couldn't happen again."

The Battle for Castle Itter stands as a strong example of just how complex history can be, and I wish more people knew about it.

Hopefully you've found this useful. If so, you can buy me a coffee here. But don't feel like you have to! /END

You've probably already heard of the many ways that #Florida's government is creating some scary times, aggressively censoring many resources our K-12 students have access to, including significant and vital African American history, education and coursework.

Teachers in my hometown are fighting back. The Freedom School in St. Pete will be offering grade 9-12 students free African American History classes — starting with the history of Africa and the Middle Passage all the way to contemporary studies and a critical lens on America's wealth, power, and global position. This material is no longer (in cases, never was) included in FLDOE curricula.

Please, if you're able to make a donation to SP Freedom School, consider doing so now. Also, you should check out their site. Below I'm going to link the Tampa Bay Times article covering their story too.

@sol You are ABSOLUTELY RIGHT that all caps are harder to read.

It’s just that is true NOT because we “read word shapes”: it is because the individual letters are less distinctive.

The best summary of this is Kevin Larson’s paper specifically debunking this myth. Interesting that it isn’t even a question in cognitive psych: it has been settled science for decades. https://www.researchgate.net/publication/237657975_The_Science_of_Word_Recognition_or_how_I_learned_to_stop_worrying_and_love_the_bouma

Rogue One: The Greatest Star Wars Movie Ever

The very first memory that I can recall is watching Star Wars: A New Hope. That opening scene with the large ship being chased by a larger ship implanted a love for science fiction that has remained with me for the rest of my life.

As much as I love the original Star Wars Trilogy:

- A New Hope
- The Empire Strikes Back
- Return of the Jedi

All of those films were supplanted by Rogue One, which I was hooked on based upon the second trailer.

https://youtu.be/sC9abcLLQpI

What I enjoyed most about Rogue One was the fact it was an actual war movie instead of a political family movie (which is what most Star Wars films are).

There were also no official Jedi in the movie, & you really witnessed a ferocious side of Darth Vader that was (in hindsight) strangely absent in the original trilogy.

Also, you got a sense that the stakes were ultimately higher in this film, & the theme was much simpler: sacrificing for a better future.

So on May Fourth (may the fourth be with you), if you are not into Star Wars or if you are, you should check this movie out as it is the best film out of all of them made, & it’s not even close! #StarWars #RogueOne #ScienceFiction #SciFi #Movies #MayTheFourthBeWithYou #May4th
